intro: Clidemia cubensis, commonly known as Cuban mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean, particularly Cuba. It belongs to the family Melastomataceae and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. It has small, elliptical leaves with a smooth texture and produces small, capsule-like fruits. Clidemia cubensis is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive appearance and ability to thrive in humid conditions.
